properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls possible this afternoon. Snow squalls near the Sault. St. Marie area will potentially reach the area this afternoon. While snowfall accumulations are not expected to be particularly heavy, visibilities could potentially be reduced at times in heavy snow. Any risk of snow squalls will come to an end by this evening as winds shift to a more westerly direction. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T08:32:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T16:33:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3061219640.2019
Area: Blind River - Thessalon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls possible this afternoon and evening. Snow squalls north of the area this morning are forecast to reach the Sault. St. Marie area this afternoon as winds become northwesterly. Local snowfall amounts up to 15 cm are possible later today before the winds shift to a more westerly direction late this evening pushing the snow squalls out of the area once again. Gusty winds will accompany these snow squalls at times resulting in periods of blowing snow. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T05:14:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T13:15:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1130330322.2019
Area: Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island, Blind River - Thessalon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. Local snowfall is affecting road conditions and visibilities along the lake Erie shoreline. Visibility within these flurries will be significantly reduced. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are possible. Travel on roads will be hazardous at times. Conditions will improve by early this afternoon as the lake effect snow bands shift southward. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-11T23:59:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T13:46:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3673696111.2019
Area: Dunnville - Caledonia - Haldimand
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls may develop this afternoon or this evening. Flurries will continue today due to gusty westerly winds. Snow squalls with reduced visibility may develop or intensify later today and continue in a few locations into Thursday morning. Local snowfall amounts of 10 to 20 cm are possible. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T03:20:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T15:54:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0334147878.2019

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extreme cold wind chill values near minus 45 again tonight. Extreme cold wind chill values near or below minus 45 are expected to develop over portions of the area again tonight into Thursday morning. ### Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A Pacific weather system will bring snow along sections of the Coquihalla Highway from Hope to Merritt. Snow will increase in intensity overnight and continue into Thursday morning as the system passes through the region. The heavy snow will ease in intensity through Thursday but periods of snow is still expected. Snow levels will remain near valley bottom except near Hope where rain is expected. Total snow amounts up to 25 cm may fall during the event for tonight and Thursday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T04:53:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T12:54:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1419071206.2019
Area: Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds are expected. Maximum gusts: westerly 100 to 110 km/h. Locations: Nain to Rigolet. Time span: continuing until this evening. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow expected today. Total snowfall: generally 5 to 10 cm, up to 15 over higher terrain. Location: Nova Scotia. Time span: today and early this evening. Remarks: Rain has changed over to snow in most regions, with a chance of intermittent freezing rain or ice pellets occurring near noon. Commuters should exercise caution as this is impacting traffic conditions in Halifax and other areas. Snow will taper to isolated flurries this evening. Accumulations may approach warning criteria in some areas, especially over higher terrain and in northern counties of the province. A snowfall warning has been issued for the Cape Breton highlands. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T04:59:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T15:10:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3388495078.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow expected today. Total snowfall: generally 5 to 10 cm, up to 15 over higher terrain. Location: Nova Scotia. Time span: today and early this evening. Remarks: Rain has changed over to snow over northern regions. This changeover will continue to move southeastward across the province this morning. Commuters should exercise caution as this is impacting traffic conditions in Halifax and other areas, with intermittent freezing rain or ice pellets occurring during the change over. Snow will taper to isolated flurries this evening. Accumulations may approach warning criteria in some areas, especially over higher terrain and in northern counties of the province. A snowfall warning has been issued for the Cape Breton highlands. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A cold arctic airmass is expected to remain in place throughout the remainder of this week. Wind chill values will moderate daily, then once again fall into the minus 45 to 50 range overnight for the next several days. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Long-lasting blizzard conditions with potentially damaging winds and persistent visibility near zero in blowing snow are expected or occurring. A strong ridge of high pressure is in place over the Northwest Territories. With low pressure over Alaska, strong winds with blowing snow are expected for northern sections of the Dempster. Near the Richardson Mountains, winds will reach 90 km/h gusting to 120 at times resulting in blizzard conditions. Blizzard conditions are forecast to improve by late Thursday. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T05:02:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T13:03:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1177206780.2019
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A frontal system passing over Haida Gwaii will spread strong southeast winds of 90 km/h gusting 110 today. As the system moves eastward, winds will ease early this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T03:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T18:06:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1703119462.2019
Area: Haida Gwaii
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls coming to an end early this afternoon. Local snow squalls will continue for a couple more hours before shifting southward out of the region this afternoon. An additional 5 to 10 cm of accumulation will be possible by the time the snow squalls come to an end. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T00:09:52-00:00

Area: West Nipissing - French River, Espanola - Killarney, Manitoulin Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Additional snowfall: 5 to 10 cm today and tonight. Maximum wind gusts: 80 to 110 km/h. Locations: Nain to Makkovik Time span: continuing until midnight tonight. Remarks: Fresh snowfall has combined with strengthening westerly winds this morning to produce poor visibility in blowing snow in Nain. Snow and blowing snow will spread southward to Hopedale and Postville-Makkovik this afternoon. Conditions are expected to improve tonight as the snow tapers off. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-12T05:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-11T14:45:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2674470354.2019
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls continuing today into tonight. Local snowfall amounts of 10 to 20 cm are possible. These snow squalls are expected to shift later today or this evening as the winds become northwesterly. Some areas may receive higher snowfall amounts as a result. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-12T08:42:14-00:00
